meanings.definition: Opposed to tobacco or the use of tobacco.
meanings.sent1: She joined the antitobacco group to help people quit smoking.
meanings.sent2: The antitobacco poster reminded everyone of the dangers of smoking.
meanings.sent3: The antitobacco message was clear: smoking is harmful to your health.
meanings.sent4: Her antitobacco stance made her a role model for healthy living.
meanings.sent5: The antitobacco movement gained momentum in the fight against smoking.

meanings.definition: A person or organization that works to prevent or reduce tobacco use.
meanings.sent1: The antitobacco distributed flyers to raise awareness about the risks of smoking.
meanings.sent2: As an antitobacco, he dedicated his life to helping others quit smoking.
meanings.sent3: The antitobacco's efforts saved many lives from the harms of tobacco.
meanings.sent4: She admired the antitobacco for their commitment to a smoke-free world.
meanings.sent5: The antitobacco's impact on public health was significant.

meanings.definition: A campaign or movement against tobacco use.
meanings.sent1: The antitobacco campaign urged people to choose a healthier lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: Joining the antitobacco movement meant standing up against smoking.
meanings.sent3: The antitobacco rally drew a large crowd of supporters against tobacco.
meanings.sent4: Her involvement in the antitobacco cause inspired others to take action.
